results.title: A Night to remember (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Sidney Hayers, William MacQuitty and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: The dramatic story of the first sailing and sinking of the ocean liner, “Titanic” in 1912. “RMS Titanic”, the liner they said was unsinkable, struck an iceberg and sank with the loss of 1500 lives. The film faithfully depicts the heroism and horror of the night the unthinkable happened. Starring Kenneth More, Laurence Naismith and David MacCallum as the radio operator. From the book by Walter Lord.

results.title: The Astonished heart
results.creator_credit: Terence Fisher, Antony Darnborough and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Noel Coward appears in this film he adapted from one of the nine one-act plays that make up the repertoire of his 1936 “Tonight at 8.30”. This repertoire included a diverse mix of song, dance and drama and was presented as a triple bill to showcase the talents of Coward and Gertrude Lawrence. This film concerns the emotional upheaval experienced by three friends who attempt to solve the problem by intellect. Psychiatrist Dr Christian Faber (Noel Coward) and his wife, Barbara (Celia Johnson) have begun to take each other for granted in their marriage. Christian begins an affair with Barbara’s best friend Leonora (Margaret Leighton). The affair is discovered by Barbara and the three avoid hurting one another over the issue. Christian is affected more deeply however, viewing his actions as a failure to meet his own moral and professional standards. Also starring Joyce Carey, Graham Payne, Amy Veness, Ralph Michael and Michael Hordern. Noel Coward also composed the musical score.

results.title: This sporting life
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Karel Reisz and Independent Artists (GB)
results.brief_description: Richard Harris gives a superb performance as Yorkshire coal miner Frank Machin, who dreams of achieving public acclaim by making a name for himself on the City Rugby team. He performs with tenacity and aggressiveness and earns a place on the team as well as 1000 pounds. His desire of being well liked extends to his personal life as he seeks the approval and affections of his widowed landlady Mrs Hammond (Rachel Roberts). After initial resistance the two become lovers and it is at this physical level that their relationship remains. When Frank’s friend marries, Mrs Hammond is racked with bitterness about her relationship and Frank responds in the only way he knows how, with violence. As tragedy strikes, Frank is left only with his sporting life. Also starring Colin Blakely, Alan Badel and William Hartnell and adapted by David Storey from his own novel.

results.title: Il Trovatore by Giuseppe Verdi
results.creator_credit: Riccardo Pellizzeri, Brian Adams and Australian Opera
results.brief_description: Sung in Italian and with English sub-titles, this performance was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, July 2, 1983 and is part of the popular ‘Esso night at the opera’. Performers include: Cynthia Johnston, Joan Sutherland, Jonathan Summers, Kenneth Collins. The Australian Opera (Sydney) conducted by Richard Bonynge. Staged by Elijah Moshinsky. Features the Australian Opera Chorus and Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra.

results.title: The North = El Norte
results.creator_credit: Gregory Nava, Anna Thomas, American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Channel 4 and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: A moving look at war-torn Guatemala and the plight of illegal aliens through the eyes of a young brother and sister. They move ‘north’ to America, for a life of freedom and happiness but as illegal immigrants their dreams quickly crumble and it will take everything they’ve got to survive the harsh reality of city life. Cast includes Zaide Silvia Gutierrez, David Villalpando, Ernesto Gomez Cruz, and Alicia del Lago.

results.title: Rocky
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone), otherwise known as the “Italian Stallion” is an underdog challenged to fight the reigning heavyweight champion, Apollo Creed (Carl Weathers). Unperturbed and inspired by his dedicated manger Mickey (Burgess Meredith) and girlfriend Adrian (Talia Shire), Rocky has his eyes on the prize and a motivation to win. It is his one chance at fortune, self-respect, love and the world heavyweight crown. Filmed in only twenty eight days and with a screenplay written by Sylvester Stallone, “Rocky” won three Academy Awards including Best Picture.

results.title: The Symphony orchestra
results.brief_description: The composer who creates symphonic music must still rely on the efforts of many other musicians for a performance of his work; and the conductor of the orchestra which is to perform a symphonic work is largely responsible for the interpretation placed on the work of the composer whose work they are to play. In this film, the function of the various choirs of the orchestra is demonstrated, as Howard Barlow conducts the Columbia Symphony Orchestra in a performance of Wagner’s “Ride of the Valkyries” and the Prelude to Act III of “Lohengrin”.
